raw_text: This formal ism allows to enrich baseline features such as the length ratio, the word-to-word (IBM 1) alignment scores with supplementary scores aimed at rewarding sentences containing identical words, etc. Morerecently, (Smith et al, 2010) reported significant improvements mining parallel Wikipedia articles using more sophisticated indicators of sentence parallelism, incorporating a richer set of features and cross-sentence dependencies within a Conditional Random Fields (CRFs) model

clean_text: As this is computationally intensive, most studies fall back to heuristics, e.g., comparing news articles close in time (Munteanu and Marcu, 2005), exploiting "inter-wiki" links in Wikipedia (Smith et al., 2010), or bootstrapping off an existing search engine (Resnik and Smith, 2003).

raw_text: (Smithet al, 2010), seek for extracting parallel sentences from comparable corpora, we present PARADOCS, a system designed to recognize pairs of parallel documents in a (large )bilingual collection of texts
clean_text: While several recent works on dealing with large bilingual collections of texts, e.g. (Smith et al., 2010), seek for extracting parallel sentences from comparable corpora, we present PARADOCS, a system designed to recognize pairs of parallel documents in a (large) bilingual collection of texts.
